key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.name: Parry Window
key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.descri: Your [key.mechanic.parry_window] is how long in seconds after you start [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) that any attack [key.mechanic.block](Blocked) will instead be [key.mechanic.parry](Parried).
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.name: Guard
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.descrip:
[key.mechanic.block_guard](Guard) is the property of [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) implements that determines how much of the blocked damage is converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage].
Higher guard values will result in less [key.stat.posture] being lost during your blocks, allowing you to block more damaging attacks safely.
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.name: Execute
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.description:
When you strike a [key.mechanic.stunned] enemy on its weak spot your strike will be a [key.mechanic.critical_hit] and you will perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
[key.mechanic.execute](Executions) deal [key.const.execution_mult] more damage by default, but many other effects will [key.mechanic.trigger] off them as well.
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.name: Triggers
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.description:
Some effects will "[key.mechanic.trigger]" other effects.
For instance [key.trigger.on_parry] triggers are triggered when you successfully [key.mechanic.parry] an attack. When an effect is triggered it may produce new results or augment whatever action initiated the trigger in some way.
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.name: Parrying
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.description:
You can [key.mechanic.parry] most attacks by [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) just before the attack lands.
You must start the [key.mechanic.block] within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) with (0.25 seconds by default).
Some effects will be able to upgrade your [key.mechanic.block](Blocks) into [key.mechanic.parry](Parries) or otherwise manipulate your [key.mechanic.parry_window].
[key.mechanic.parry](Parries) will completely negate the damage of an attack and also prevent any [key.mechanic.posture_damage] you may receive.
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.name: Blocking
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.description:
You can [key.mechanic.block] by holding an object capable of blocking (most weapons will work) in one of your hands and pressing your [key.input.block] key.
When you [key.mechanic.block] an attack you will take [key.mechanic.posture_damage] based on the damage dealt by the attack and the [key.mechanic.block_guard] values on your blocking implement.
Higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values will result in less [key.stat.posture] damage being received.
As long as your [key.stat.posture] stays above zero, you will take no damage from the blocked attack. You may still receive some other effects from the blocket attack however.
If your [key.stat.posture] reaches zero you will be [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) and any excess damage will carry through as normal.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) you will be unable to block until your [key.stat.posture] fully recharges, however, you can still [key.mechanic.parry] even when [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
You can [key.mechanic.parry] nearly every attack that you can [key.mechanic.block] by starting your block within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're using (0.25 seconds by default).
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.name: Posture Damage
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.desc:
[key.mechanic.posture_damage] is received (usually) when you [key.mechanic.block] an attack without [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) it.
Some effects will be able to damage your [key.stat.posture] without being able to [key.mechanic.posture_break](Break) it.
 Taking [key.mechanic.posture_damage] does not carry any immediate downsides, but can be dangerous if you run out of [key.stat.posture].
If you [key.mechanic.block] an attack that takes your [key.stat.posture] to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken), preventing you from [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) until your [key.stat.posture] regenerates completely.
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.name: Posture Break
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.descr:
When an effect capable of breaking your [key.stat.posture] reduces it to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken). The most common cause of this is [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) an attack without enough [key.stat.posture] to prevent all the damage.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) your [key.mechanic.block](Blocks) will not prevent any damage and you must wait until your [key.stat.posture] completely recharges before you will be able to [key.mechanic.block] again.
You are still able to [key.mechanic.parry] attacks even while [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
key.mechanic.stability.tooltip.name: Stability
key.flavour.important: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.flavour.positive: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.flavour.negative: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.variable.positive: You shouldn't see me!! Yell at fortune :)
key.variable.negative: You shouldn't see me!! Yell at fortune :)
